alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Crawford; Houston; Macon; Peach; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 11:17AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Macon, southern Bibb, southwestern Twiggs, Peach, northern Houston and southeastern Crawford Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1117 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Jack Brown Estates to near Lee Pope to near Nakomis, and moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Perry, Fort Valley, Jeffersonville, Warner Robins, Centerville, Byron, Robins AFB, Marion, Tarversville, Nakomis, Robins Air Force Base, Houston Lake, District Path, Powerville, Skipperton, Miami Valley, Kathleen, Jack Brown Estates, Sand Bed and Bullard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Bibb; Crawford; Houston; Macon; Peach; Twiggs
